Key Match Events: Spencer Dinwiddie scored 11 of Dallas' first 19 points
P.J. Washington scored 16 points in a row for the Mavs
De'Aaron Fox hit a three following a turnover to cut it to one
Domantas Sabonis rolled in a finger roll to take the lead, 45-44
A 20-footer by De'Aaron Fox closed off a 17-2 run, with Sacramento taking an 83-77 lead into the fourth quarter
A Trey Lyles three extended the Sacramento lead to 10, 88-78
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were down four starters due to injuries: Luka Doncic, Dereck Lively II, Kyrie Irving, and Klay Thompson
The Mavs picked up a win, even against a Kings squad that is reeling after firing their head coach on Friday
Dallas dared Sacramento to shoot from the outside, as their starting five entered the game shooting 28.7% from three-point range in their last five games, easily the worst mark in the league
Post-Match Reflections: Spencer Dinwiddie led the Mavericks with a season-high 30 points, the most he's scored since the 2022-23 season
P.J. Washington wasn't far behind with 28 points
De'Aaron Fox led Sacramento with a massive 33 points to break their six-game losing streak
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks shot just 42.1% from the floor in this game
Sacramento came down with 18 offensive rebounds to Dallas' two
The Mavericks also shot 24 fewer shots than the Kings
